required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Family Planning Service Delivery Integration For HIV Positive And At-Risk Women In Botswana: A Hybrid Type 2 Clinical Intervention And Implementation Strategy
clinical_study.official_title: Family Planning Service Delivery Integration For HIV Positive And At-Risk Women In Botswana: A Hybrid Type 2 Clinical Intervention And Implementation Strategy

collaborator.agency: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this pilot study is to assess both implementation outcomes (acceptability, feasibility and adoption) and clinical efficacy (contraceptive method uptake by women wishing to avoid pregnancy) using a Hybrid Type 2 study design of a family planning program being piloted by the Cervical Cancer Prevention Program in Gabarone, Botswana.

primary_outcome.description: Likert scale 1-5, rating acceptability of offering family planning in this clinical setting.
Likert scale 1-5, rating feasibility of offering family planning in this clinical setting

primary_outcome.measure: Provider report of adoption of the intervention
primary_outcome.description: Comparing number of family planning methods offered by a provider pre- and post-intervention

arm_group.description: Our goal is to assess the feasibility and acceptability of incorporating family planning (FP) service delivery, using a program validated by the World Health Organization (WHO), into the established Cervical Cancer Prevention (CCP) programs of Botswana.

intervention.intervention_name: WHO Decision-Making Tool for Family Planning Clients and Providers

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Female
2. English or Setswana speaking
3. Receiving CCP services at the clinic
4. 18-45 years of age
5. Able to give informed consent to study procedures, as determined by research/clinic staff
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Pregnant
